snippet: The new study found there was no difference in the aortic growth rate between those taking losartan and those taking the standard treatment.
abstract: Three-year study published in The New England Journal of Medicine reveals that blood pressure drug found to block the effects of a gene mutation that causes Marfan syndrome, condition that leads to heart problems, is no more effective than standard treatment.
lead_paragraph: The new study found there was no difference in the aortic growth rate between those taking losartan and those taking the standard treatment.

headline.main: Heart Drug, Losartan, Falls Short of Promise in a Study
headline.print_headline: Heart Drug Falls Short of Promise in a Study
